docs.lead_paragraph: Abortions have declined in states where new laws make it harder to have them — but they've also waned in states where abortion rights are protected, an Associated Press survey finds. Nearly everywhere, in red states and blue, abortions are down since 2010.

headline.main: AP Exclusive: Abortions Declining in Nearly All States
headline.print_headline: AP Exclusive: Abortions Declining in Nearly All States

docs.lead_paragraph: There is a collision course between feminists and transgender activists.
docs.abstract: Op-Ed article by Elinor Burkett expresses discomfort with way Caitlyn Jenner and other transgender people have defined femininity, noting that it devalues the lived experience of many women; notes that many women find language used by trans activists to explain themselves as insulting; observes that trans activists and women should be natural allies in overcoming gender stereotyping.
docs.snippet: There is a collision course between feminists and transgender activists.

docs.lead_paragraph: Former Florida Gov. Jeb Bush will run for the 2016 Republican presidential nomination, aides say, and plans to announce that June 15. Here's where he stands on some of the issues likely to be debated in the campaign.

headline.main: Where They Stand: Bush on Key Topics of 2016 Campaign
headline.print_headline: Where They Stand: Bush on Key Topics of 2016 Campaign

docs.lead_paragraph: A bipartisan group of U.S. lawmakers introduced legislation on Thursday to boost protections for pregnant workers in response to a recent U.S. Supreme Court ruling that revived discrimination claims by a former United Parcel Service Inc  driver.

docs.lead_paragraph: Four members of a Texas family have been arrested on suspicion of beating a 14-year-old relative to induce an abortion two years ago after she had been raped by a member of the family, Dallas police said on Wednesday.

headline.print_headline: Four Texas Family Members Suspected of Beating 14-Year-Old to Abort Baby
